metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3573 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free in function hci_sock_bound_ioctl() of the Linux kernel HCIsubsystem was found in the way user calls ioct HCIUNBLOCKADDR or other waytriggers race condition of the call hci_unregister_dev() together with oneof the calls hci_sock_blacklist_add(), hci_sock_blacklist_del(),hci_get_conn_info(), hci_get_auth_info(). A privileged local user could usethis flaw to crash the system or escalate their privileges on the system.This flaw affects the Linux kernel versions prior to 5.13-rc5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3573` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
